text:
1. Your full name: MRS. GEORGINA TILLING

2. Your address: REGINA GERIATRIC (CENTER)

3. Date: MARCH 15TH/62

4. Where were you born? (Give name of place and country): LONDON ENGLAND

5. What was your father's name and occupation? MR. JOHNY TAYLOR, LABORER.

6. When did you come to Saskatchewan? (Give month and year): SPRING 1889

7. Mention any other places where you lived before coming to Saskatchewan, giving dates wherever possible: NIAGARA ONT. 1874-1889

8. How old were you when you first came to Western Canada? (You do not need to answer this question if you would rather not or you may use "I was a small child," "I was in my teens," etc.) 14 YEARS

9. What were your reasons for coming West? TO JOIN MY FATHER WHO HAD COME WEST A FEW MONTHS PREVIOUS

10. How did you learn about the West? (Through other people? Reading about it? Railroad or government information?) EVERYBODY IN THE EAST HAD THE CRAZE TO COME TO THE NORTH WEST TERRITORIES
1. Your full name: Mrs. Gertrude Tilling

2. Your address: Regina Geriatric Centre

3. Date: March 15th 1962

4. Where were you born? (Give name of place and country): London, England

5. What was your father's name and occupation?: Mr. John Taylor, Laborer

6. When did you come to Saskatchewan? (Give month and year): Spring 1889

7. Mention any other places where you lived before coming to Saskatchewan, giving dates wherever possible: Niagara, Ont., 1871-1889

8. How old were you when you first came to Western Canada? (You do not need to answer this question if you would rather not or you may use "I was a small child," "I was in my teens," etc.): 14 years

9. What were your reasons for coming West? To join my father who had come west a few months previous

10. How did you learn about the West? (Through other people? Reading about it? Railroad every body in the east had the craze to come to the north west territories)
11. What did your friends and relatives think of your decision to come to Western Canada? They did not think very much of it.

12. Did you travel by yourself or with a party (family, friends or other group)? With my mother.

13. What means of transportation did you use? By train from St. Catharines Ont. To Whitehead Sask via Chicago, no railway through the Great Lakes region at that time.

14. What incidents of the journey West do you remember? (People you met on the way, meetings with Indians, adventures on the journey, accidents or other excitement, etc.) Nothing in particular.

15. Where did you first stay when you arrived in Saskatchewan? Whitewood, Sask. Then the N.W.T.

16. Where did you settle or take up land? At Whitewood.

17. Mention any other places where you have lived since coming to Saskatchewan. Worked in Regina about four years in Manitoba after farming about 12 miles south of Boissevain after my marriage to Mr. Tilling.

18. How did you earn a living before coming to Western Canada? How, after you came? My father ran a farm at Niagara. I attended school, after coming to Sask., I kept house for a while.
11. What did your friends and relatives think of your decision to come to Western Canada?
   They did not think very much of it.

12. Did you travel by yourself or with a party (family, friends or other group)?
   With my mother.

13. What means of transportation did you use?
   By train from St Catharines Ont.
   To Whitehead Sask via Chicago-Chicago railway
   To Minneapolis and Winnipeg, no railway
   Through the great lakes region at that

14. What accidents of the journey West do you remember? (People you met on the way, meetings
   with Indians, adventures on the journey, accidents or other excitement, etc.)
   Nothing in particular

15. Where did you first stay when you arrived in Saskatchewan?
   Whitehead, Sask. Then the N.W.T.

16. Where did you settle or take up land?
   At Whitehead

17. Mention any other places where you have lived since coming to Saskatchewan
   Worked in Regina four years in Manitoba after
   Farming about 12 miles south of Boissevain after
   My marriage to Mr Tilling

18. How did you earn a living before coming to Western Canada? How, after you came?
   My father ran a farm at Niagarra
   I attended school after coming
   I kept house for a while
19. How often did you write to relatives or friends in your old home?

20. If you got married, give the name of your husband or wife along with the date and place of marriage.

21. Did anyone else come to Saskatchewan because of your recommendation? If so, where did they settle?

22. If other members of your family (brothers, sisters, parents, etc.) came West, tell when they came and where they settled.

23. Is there any particular experience of pioneer days that stands out in your memory which you would like to record?

24. Did you travel about much in the early years? (for business, attending church, visiting friends, etc.) How often? How far? By what means of travel?

NO

Drove the mail to the north of Whitewood for my father John Taylor for 3 winters 1892-1894

WHAT TRAVELLING WAS DONE WAS BY HORSE AND BUGGY
19. How often did you write to relatives or friends in your old home?

20. If you got married give the name of your husband or wife along with the date and place of marriage.

21. Did anyone else come to Saskatchewan because of your recommendation as a place to settle?

22. If other members of your family (brothers, sisters, parents, etc.) came West, tell when they came and where they settled.

23. Is there any particular experience of pioneer days that stands out in your memory which you would like to record?

24. Did you travel about much in the early years? (for business, attending church, visiting friends, etc.) How often? How far? By what means of travel?

NORTH OF WHITEWOOD FOR MY FATHER JOHN TAYLOR FOR 3 WINTERS 1892-1894

NOT TOO MUCH. WHAT TRAVELING WAS DONE WAS BY HORSE AND BUGGY
25. When was the first car used in the community?  
   ABOUT 1910

26. If you owned a car before 1914, when did you buy it? What make?
   
27. Where was your trading center? How far from your home?
   AT WHITEWOOD

28. Did you continue to trade there? (Indicate any changes due to new towns appearing, better means of travel, etc.)
   YES

29. How often did you shop in the early days?
   WEEKLY

30. When (if ever) did people in your district first start going to town regularly on Saturdays?

31. When (if ever) did you first begin to buy through the mail order catalogues? What kind of articles did you buy in this way? Indicate also what fraction of your total purchases were by mail order and any changes in the proportion of purchases made by mail order since the pioneer period.

32. When did you first have a telephone and what company provided it?

33. When you came to Saskatchewan the first time was it with the idea of staying permanently? Or did you make up your mind after trying it out? When did you make this decision?
   YES
25. When was the first car used in the community?  
   ABOUT 1910

26. If you owned a car before 1914, when did you buy it? What make?
   
27. Where was your trading center? How far from your home?
   AT WHITEWOOD

28. Did you continue to trade there? (Indicate any changes due to new towns appearing, better means of travel, etc.)
   YES

29. How often did you shop in the early days?
   WEEKLY

30. When (if ever) did people in your district first start going to town regularly on Saturdays?

31. When (if ever) did you first begin to buy through the mail order catalogues? What kind of articles did you buy in this way? Indicate also what fraction of your total purchases were by mail order and any changes in the proportion of purchases made by mail order since the pioneer period.

32. When did you first have a telephone and what company provided it?

33. When you came to Saskatchewan the first time was it with the idea of staying permanently? Or did you make up your mind after trying it out? When did you make this decision?
   YES
34. Did any people move away from your district prior to 1914? What reasons did they have for moving?

35. Did many people move away during the 1920s? Did many return?

36. If you or some members of your family have held public office, or have been active in any organizations, mention it here, giving dates wherever possible.

37. If you or any of your family or friends were "first" to have or do something in the district, mention it here giving dates wherever possible. (Such as owning the first automobile, combining, organizing the first lodge, etc.)

My dad Mr. J. Taylor & my husband Mrs. Wilson built the Commercial Hotel in White Rock. After my dad returned from the real revolution where he hauled supplies, he homesteaded 16 miles east of White Rock.

38. How did the places in your community get their names? (School district, Post Offices, villages, railway stations, creeks, hills, etc.) Try to give: (1) name and occupation of person suggesting place-name, (2) origin and meaning of the name, (3) date of its adoption, (4) any changes in names since the first name was given, date and reason for change. Give facts of new name as above in (1), (2), (3).
34. Did any people move away from your district prior to 1914? What reasons did they have for moving?

35. Did many people move away during the 1930s? Did many return?

36. If you or some member of your family have held public office, or have been active in any organizations, mention it here, giving dates wherever possible.

37. If you or any of your family or friends were "frin" to have or do something in the district, mention it here giving dates wherever possible. (Such as owning the first automobile, building, organizing the first lodge, etc.)

My dad Mr. Taylor & my husband Mr. Wilson built the Commercial Hotel in White Wolf Goddard after my dad returned from the real rebellion where he hauled supplies. He homesteaded 16 acres east of White Wolf Goddard.

38. How did the places in your community get their names? (School district, post offices, villages, railway stations, creeks, hills, etc.) Try to give: (1) name and occupation of person suggesting place-name, (2) origin and meaning of the name, (3) date of its adoption, (4) any changes in name since the first name was given, date and reason for change. Give facts of new name as above in (1), (2), (3).
6.

39. Questions regarding historical source materials:

Do you have in your possession or do you know the whereabouts of diaries, old letters, old posters and programs, minute books of community organizations, old pamphlets, old photographs, written recollections and reminiscences? (Describe.)

No

Would you or the person who owns them either

(1) be willing to lend them to the Provincial Archivist for copying?

(2) be willing to present them to the Archives Division of the Legislative Library, Regina, or the Archives Office at the University in Saskatoon?

(Indicate your preference, if any)

40. If you have children or grandchildren, please give their names, where they live and occupations.

J.M. IVANSON, EDMONTON, S.O.W.
W.J.R. TILLING, 2263 QUEEN ST., REGINA
MRS. A.C. MARSHALL, 1318 MCTAVISH ST., REGINA
DAUGHTER, REGINA
MRS. A.R. HORNE, BURNABY, BC DAUGHTER

41. What do you think are the most important changes in your community since you first came West?

Please give the names and addresses of other pioneers who could answer this questionnaire.

If someone else has filled in this questionnaire for you, please have this person give name and address here:

W.J.R. TILLING
2263 QUEEN ST.
REGINA
6. Questions regarding historical source materials:

Do you have in your possession or do you know the whereabouts of diaries, old letters, old posters and programs, minute books of community organizations, old pamphlets, old photographs, written recollections and reminiscences? (Describe.)

Would you or the person who owns them either

(1) be willing to lend them to the Provincial Archives for copying?

(2) be willing to present them to the Archives Division of the Legislative Library, Regina, or the Archives Office at the University in Saskatoon?

(Indicate your preference, if any)

40. If you have children or grandchildren, please give their names, where they live and occupations.

J.M. WILSON, EDMONTON, SASKATCHEWAN
W.J.R. TILLING, 2263 QUEEN ST., REGINA
MRS. A.C. MARSHALL, 1318 MCTAVISH ST., REGINA
DAUGHTER, REGINA
